definition: to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: The navy tied the enemy down with gunfire.
The army pinned  the enemy to its ground by powerful infantry attacks.
sentences.chinese: 部队以强大的步兵进攻来牵制敌人使其不能离开。

sentences.english: The aggressors could not get supplies or reinforcements through because of the guerrilla warfare.
sentences.chinese: 由于游击战的牵制，侵略者无法输送给养或援兵。

sentences.english: Large numbers of the enemy's main force were at last pinned down.
sentences.chinese: 敌人的许多主力部队终于被牵制住了。

sentences.english: The main force of the enemy met with a check.
sentences.chinese: 敌人的主力受到了牵制。

sentences.english: She said she became a butterfly pinned down and singing away in Movieland.
sentences.chinese: 她说，她成为牵制蝴蝶在电影园地和唱歌了。

sentences.english: The navy tied the enemy down with big gun fired while the marines landed on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 陆战队在海滩登陆时，海军用猛烈的炮火牵制敌人。

sentences.english: The soldiers tried to keep the attacking enemy in check until help came.
sentences.chinese: 战士们设法牵制住敌人，等待援兵到来。

sentences.english: The procedural restriction is beneficial to promote the reasonable change of power structure.
sentences.chinese: 程序的牵制性有助于催发权力结构的合理变化。

sentences.english: At minimum, that would unsettleJapanto the north and thePhilippinesto the south.
sentences.chinese: 至少，坐拥台湾能够向北牵制日本，南扼菲律宾。

sentences.english: Our solders knew how to pin down enemies.
sentences.chinese: 我们的战士知道如何牵制敌人。

sentences.english: If the horse had not been held in, he would have cleared the fence.
sentences.chinese: 如果这匹马不受牵制，它就会跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: The task of their regiment was to pin down one of the flanks of the invading army.
sentences.chinese: 他们团的任务是牵制侵略军的侧翼。

sentences.english: Chained by his certitudes , he is a slave, he has forfeited freedom.
sentences.chinese: 被他的信念牵制着，他是一个奴隶，他丧失了自由。

sentences.english: They enabled him to escape by keeping his attackers in play.
sentences.chinese: 他们牵制住攻击他的人，才使他得以逃掉。

sentences.english: Cloud empty and a clear firmly hold the fir the pace of progress.
sentences.chinese: 云空和一清牢牢地牵制了杉木等人前进的步伐。

definition: pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
